structure.unit: FORMALITY AND ASSIGNABILITY OF CONTRACTS -- INSTALLMENT SALES CONTRACTS

law.catch_line: Seal not necessary on any writing -- Exceptions.
law.text: A seal or scroll is not necessary in order to give effect to any writing. All unsealed writings shall stand upon the same footing with sealed writings, shall have the same effect, and the same actions may be brought thereon. This section does not apply to any law requiring the state or county seal or the seal of a court, corporation or notary to any writing.
law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 471.
